pullrequest.title: fix dsl code for flaky test publisher

content.raw:
Ouch sorry for did not notice it before.

Short explanation: the configure block is using when there is not native support for some plugins or some plugins options since it can generate XML directly which will work in jenkins. If there is native support (documented in the jenkins-dsl API viewer) then is better to use it than define a configure block.

To test locally if the generation of DSL is successful I would recommend to use the commands in ["Run a DSL Script locally"](https://github.com/jenkinsci/job-dsl-plugin/wiki/User-Power-Moves) section  which help to know if there is a problem in the DSL scripts.
content.html:
Ouch sorry for did not notice it before.

Short explanation: the configure block is using when there is not native support for some plugins or some plugins options since it can generate XML directly which will work in jenkins. If there is native support (documented in the jenkins-dsl API viewer) then is better to use it than define a configure block.

To test locally if the generation of DSL is successful I would recommend to use the commands in "Run a DSL Script locally" section which help to know if there is a problem in the DSL scripts.
